result.execSummary:
The defendant ANTHONY J. HEFTER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. ANTHONY J. HEFTER is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • ANTHONY J. HEFTER was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: ***Expungement shall be granted if in compliance with Wisconsin Statute Section 973.015.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. ANTHONY J. HEFTER

records.addlTxt: 10:31 AM  Defendant ANTHONY J. HEFTER in court.  Attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich in court for ANTHONY J. HEFTER.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Plea agreement entered onto court record for a probation term.  Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Victim/Witness rights complied with.  Defense argues for expungement upon successful completion of probation.
